messages: e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:13): good morning, Whatwg!
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:19): hyv?§?§ iltaa
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:21): I love umlauts.
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:28): those aren't actually umlauts, but separate letters ;)
020b48854d7db62a6e68871c72d26e49 (18:30): letters with umlauts?
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:30): ?§ is a letter itself
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:31): what is the pronunciation effect of two of them?
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:32): You mean having two ?§-letters? It is just longer sound
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:32): Finnish is easy to pronounce
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:33): is it pretty much speak out each letter?
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:33): like Russian
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:34): that's nice. What about grammar?
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:35): well, you can put words almost in any order, so it is easy.
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:36): but picking up the right form of some word can be tricky
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:37): If I trust one source...it says there can be 2253 different forms of every noun
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:37): sounds about right
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:38): but there's logic to that, right? You don't have to just memorize?
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:38): yeah, there is quite simple logic
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:39): http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Finnish_morphology#Noun_forms
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:43): ah! very similar to Russian: en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Russian_grammar
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:44): annevk, the test bugs in surroundContents are due to changes in testharness.js after the test was written, which are in turn due to spec changes.
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (18:45): e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024: your letters make that all hard :)
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:46): annevk, hmm, so we throw InvalidStateError for two things in surroundContents?  That's not good.
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:47): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: do you have somewhere spec'd how window.getSelection() reacts to selections in iframes?
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:48): e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024, seems not right now, no.  I think I have feedback asking me to look into it, which I plan to do.
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:49): 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762: cool. I'll just write up something that makes sense for shadow DOM (which is a similar situation).
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:49): e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024, I think the current theory is there's one selection per window, so iframes have a different selection.
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (18:49): ah, so it's not similar.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:50): annevk, pushed a fix to the test bugs.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (18:50): Oh, right, the fix isn't approved.
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (19:03): is amazed how www-style can have such a long and silly discussion about using forums
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (19:05): yikes, why is getSelection on both window and document?
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (19:05): historical reasons?
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (19:06): probably
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (19:06): ""Deprecated method document.getSelection() called. Please use window.getSelection() instead."" was added to Gecko 2001
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (19:07): I think that warning has been removed
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (19:08): maybe 88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 knows
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:08): e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024, I don't know the history.  But that's what implementations do.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:09): Until a few months ago, Gecko implemented document.getSelection() as returning a string, but now I think we have interop.
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (19:09): Apparently document.getSelection has been in Gecko since 1998, so it could be Netscapeism
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:10): Yes, I'm pretty sure it dates to Netscape.
88d4d34a8064a4ff39fd5e144eea7762 (19:10): Maybe it was originally on Document only, but then people realized it made more sense on Window.
e9fe2a8ed6a64844a5c024b6f688d024 (19:12): fascinating
6b57ea7f33069df5914663ba9e59afdf (19:13): window.getSelection was added to Gecko 2000
